intro: Eritrichium multicaule, commonly known as the clustered eritrichium, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its small, clustered inflorescences bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Eritrichium multicaule is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in high-altitude ecosystems.
